metadata.description: Famous haiku from the canon for plagiarism detection

haiku.text:
old pond
a frog jumps in
water's sound
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
the old pond
a frog jumps in
sound of water
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
on a bare branch
a crow has settled
autumn evening
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
the sea darkens
the voices of the wild ducks
are faintly white
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
nothing in the cry
of cicadas suggests
they are about to die
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
the first cold shower
even the monkey seems to want
a little coat of straw
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
in the cicada's cry
no sign can foretell
how soon it must die
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
an old silent pond
a frog jumps into the pond
splash silence again
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
temple bells die out
the fragrant blossoms remain
a perfect evening
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
along this road
goes no one
this autumn evening
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
a caterpillar
this deep in fall
still not a butterfly
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
first day of spring
I keep thinking about
the end of autumn
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
clouds come from time to time
and bring to men a chance to rest
from looking at the moon
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
summer grasses
all that remains
of soldiers' dreams
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
the light of a candle
is transferred to another candle
spring twilight
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
sick on a journey
my dreams wander
the withered fields
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
no one travels
along this way but I
this autumn evening
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
come let us go
snow viewing
till we are buried
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
how reluctantly
the bee emerges from deep
within the peony
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
do not forget the plum
blooming in the thicket
there
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
the winter sun
the rider's shadow
creeps beside him
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
from every direction
cherry blossoms blow into
the lake of Nara
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
spring departs
birds cry
fishes' eyes are filled with tears
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
stillness
the sound of cicadas
penetrates the rocks
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
you light the fire
I'll show you something nice
a great ball of snow
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
the piercing chill I feel
my dead wife's comb in our bedroom
stepping on it
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
a tethered horse
snow in both stirrups
winter moonlight
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
the old man
cutting barley
bent like a sickle
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
in the moonlight
the color and scent of the wisteria
seems far away
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
white plum blossoms
night turns to dawn
at the writing desk
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
lighting one candle
with another candle
spring evening
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
they end their decaying
each in their own way
the flowers
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
on the temple bell
has settled and is fast asleep
a butterfly
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
the short night
broken eggshells
in the chicken nest
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
spring rain
everything just grows
more beautiful
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
calligraphy of geese
against the sky
the moon seals it
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
before the white chrysanthemum
the scissors hesitate
a moment
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
coolness of the melons
flecked with mud
in the morning dew
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
a flash of lightning
through the darkness
goes the cry of the heron
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
departing spring
with belated cherry blossoms
shilly-shallying
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
deep in a windless
wood a thin persimmon tree
still with all its fruit
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
O snail
climb Mount Fuji
but slowly slowly
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
the snow is melting
and the village is flooded
with children
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
don't weep insects
lovers stars themselves
must part
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
a world of dew
and within every dewdrop
a world of struggle
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
in this world
we walk on the roof of hell
gathering flowers
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
the distant mountains
are reflected in the eye
of the dragonfly
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
everything I touch
with tenderness alas
pricks like a bramble
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
under the cherry
blossoms none are
utterly strangers
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
the world of dew
is the world of dew
and yet and yet
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
what good luck
stumbling from the horse
into flowers
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
goes out
comes back
the love life of a cat
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
don't worry spiders
I keep house
casually
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
children imitating cormorants
are even more wonderful
than cormorants
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
trusting the Buddha
good and bad
I bid farewell to the departing year
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
new year's day
everything is in blossom
I feel about average
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
mosquito at my ear
does it think
I'm deaf
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
what a strange thing
to be alive
beneath cherry blossoms
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
when I look carefully
I see the nazuna blooming
by the hedge
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
I am sick and tired
the peony
burning in the rain
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
after killing a spider
how lonely I feel
in the cold of night
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
the summer river
although there is a bridge my horse
goes through the water
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
in the white plum tree
night to next day
turning
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
I want to sleep
swat the flies
swat the flies softly please
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
for love and for hate
I swat a fly and offer it
to an ant
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
a lightning flash
between the forest trees
I have seen water
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
a mountain village
under the piled up snow
the sound of water
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
autumn wind
colored stones
on the riverbed
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
bright autumn moon
pond snails crying
in the saucepan
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
the night is long
the sound of water
says what I think
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
beside my bed
a winter violet
alone
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
such stillness
the chirp of insects
penetrates the rocks
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
green caterpillar
on the reddening leaf
green still
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
autumn coolness
hand upon hand
peel a pear
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
morning glory
the well-bucket entangled
I ask for water
haiku.author: Chiyo-ni

haiku.text:
the dragonfly
would like to rest but
has no place to stay
haiku.author: Chiyo-ni

haiku.text:
if only we could
add a handle to the moon
what a fine fan
haiku.author: Chiyo-ni

haiku.text:
walking into the wind
fallen leaves
get up and follow me
haiku.author: Taneda Santoka

haiku.text:
dripping wet
I just keep walking
and walking
haiku.author: Taneda Santoka

haiku.text:
at the bottom
of the begging bowl
rain
haiku.author: Taneda Santoka

haiku.text:
over-ripe sushi
the Master
is full of regret
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
blowing from the west
fallen leaves gather
in the east
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
the river
darker than the sky
autumn evening
haiku.author: Kawabata Bosha

haiku.text:
above the boat
bellies of wild geese
at twilight
haiku.author: Kawabata Bosha

haiku.text:
the lamp once out
cool stars enter
the window frame
haiku.author: Natsume Soseki

haiku.text:
over the wintry
forest winds howl in a rage
with no leaves to blow
haiku.author: Natsume Soseki

haiku.text:
the old dog bends his head listening
I didn't hear anything
did you
haiku.author: Jack Kerouac

haiku.text:
in my medicine cabinet
the winter fly
has died of old age
haiku.author: Jack Kerouac

haiku.text:
arms folded
to the moon
among the cows
haiku.author: Jack Kerouac

haiku.text:
the taste
of rain
why kneel
haiku.author: Jack Kerouac

haiku.text:
birds singing
in the dark
rainy dawn
haiku.author: Jack Kerouac

haiku.text:
missing a kick
at the icebox door
it closed anyway
haiku.author: Jack Kerouac

haiku.text:
useless useless
heavy rain
driving into the sea
haiku.author: Jack Kerouac

haiku.text:
looking up
I see the wild geese
and my loneliness
haiku.author: Richard Wright

haiku.text:
in the falling snow
a laughing boy holds out his palms
until they are white
haiku.author: Richard Wright

haiku.text:
the crow flew so fast
that he left
his lonely caw behind
haiku.author: Richard Wright

haiku.text:
coming from the woods
a bull has a lilac sprig
caught in his horns
haiku.author: Richard Wright

haiku.text:
I am nobody
a red sinking autumn sun
took my name away
haiku.author: Richard Wright

haiku.text:
whiteness of the birch
tiny bird tracks in the snow
lead to nothing
haiku.author: Richard Wright

haiku.text:
from across the lake
past the black winter trees
faint sounds of a flute
haiku.author: Richard Wright

haiku.text:
a bath of cold water
and then I felt
my butt was even flatter
haiku.author: Allen Ginsberg

haiku.text:
looking over my shoulder
my behind was too big
to see the other shore
haiku.author: Allen Ginsberg

haiku.text:
the summer chair
rocking by itself
in the blizzard
haiku.author: Raymond Roseliep

haiku.text:
campfire extinguished
the woman washing dishes
in a pan of stars
haiku.author: Raymond Roseliep

haiku.text:
meteor shower
a gentle wave
wets our sandals
haiku.author: Michael Dylan Welch

haiku.text:
lily
out of the water
out of itself
haiku.author: Nick Virgilio

haiku.text:
bass
jarring my arm
joint by joint
haiku.author: Nick Virgilio

haiku.text:
the sack of kittens
sinking in the icy creek
increases the water
haiku.author: Nick Virgilio

haiku.text:
the town dump
smoldering in rain
drizzle
haiku.author: Nick Virgilio

haiku.text:
a petal shower
of plum blossoms
wings of a butterfly
haiku.author: Robert Hass

haiku.text:
after weeks of watching the roof leak
I fixed it tonight
by placing a new bucket beneath the drip
haiku.author: Robert Hass

haiku.text:
old dark sleepless night
the wood cracks
some wood cracks
haiku.author: Paul Celan

haiku.text:
the green cockleburs
caught in the thick wool of his socks
bringing him home
haiku.author: Cor van den Heuvel

haiku.text: the shadow in the folded napkin
haiku.author: Cor van den Heuvel

haiku.text: tundra
haiku.author: Cor van den Heuvel

haiku.text:
holding the water
held by it
the water jar
haiku.author: Dag Hammarskjold

haiku.text:
autumn moonlight
a worm digs silently
into the chestnut
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
sleeping butterfly
wake up wake up
I have business with you
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
year after year
on the monkey's face
a monkey's mask
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
won't you come and see
loneliness just one leaf
from the kiri tree
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
red berries
and the red mouths
of the children
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
sparrow's child
out of the way out of the way
the horse is coming
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
this dewdrop world
is a dewdrop world
and yet and yet
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
my spring is just this
a single bamboo shoot
a willow branch
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
the wind from Mt Fuji
I put it on the fan
here a souvenir from Edo
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
a bee
stumbles out
of the peony
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
seven sights were veiled
in mist
then I heard Mii Temple's bell
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
in the dark forest
a berry drops
the sound of water
haiku.author: Takahama Kyoshi

haiku.text:
a snake sloughed
its skin lay there
in front of my door
haiku.author: Takahama Kyoshi

haiku.text:
heat shimmer
the faces of the flowers
not yet open
haiku.author: Iida Dakotsu

haiku.text:
late autumn
my neighbor
what does he do
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
even in Kyoto
hearing the cuckoo's cry
I long for Kyoto
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
the whole field
bows and trembles
under the skylark's song
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
a field of cotton
as if the moon
had flowered
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
under cherry trees
soup salad fish and all
seasoned with petals
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
harvest moon
walking around the pond
all night long
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
leap year
forty-nine years
of foolishness
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
on a withered branch
a crow has alighted
nightfall in autumn
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
my old village
even the flies
bite visitors
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
here too here too
this suffering world
flowers bloom
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
now then let's go out
to enjoy the snow until
I slip and fall
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
spring is leaving
the birds cry
and the fishes' eyes are wet with tears
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
winter seclusion
listening that evening
to the rain in the mountain
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
with every gust of wind
the butterfly changes its place
on the willow
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
bush clover in bloom
swaying swaying
touched by deer
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
the faces of dolls
for no reason or other
they make me lonely
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
the short night
the peony opened
during that time
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
a bat flits
in moonlight
above the plum blossoms
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
in nooks and corners
cold remains
flowers of the plum
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
a snowy morning
by myself
chewing on dried salmon
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
spring is passing
the birds cry and the fishes'
eyes are wet with tears
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
the winter fly
I caught andستفاد
it buzzed in my hand
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
the snail gets up
and goes to bed
with very little fuss
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
snow on the pine
that crooked old pine tree
how lovely
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
a giant firefly
that way this way that way this
and it passes by
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
visiting the graves
the old dog leads the way
down the path
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
first autumn morning
the mirror I stare into
shows my father's face
haiku.author: Murakami Kijo

haiku.text:
the wind has settled
the petals still falling
peace
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
such a moon
the thief
pauses to sing
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
the pheasant cries
as though it just noticed
the mountain
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
rain on the mountain
and on the town too
rain
haiku.author: Ozaki Hosai

haiku.text:
only one guy and
only one fly alive
in the bar
haiku.author: Jack Kerouac

haiku.text:
the geese have gone
but the river sounds
remain the same
haiku.author: Fukuda Chiyo-ni

haiku.text:
how cool it feels
putting the feet on the wall
an afternoon nap
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
ah this spring rain
a small child teaches
the kitten to dance
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
don't kill that fly
look it wrings its hands
it wrings its feet
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
chrysanthemum petals
circling a pair of scissors
on the tatami
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
wild geese returning
the line wobbles
across the moon
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
suddenly aware
of all the people in
this spring rain
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
a day of quiet gladness
Mount Fuji is veiled
in misty rain
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
turning from
the fresh grave
youngest daughter
haiku.author: Nick Virgilio

haiku.text:
out of the water
out of itself
lily
haiku.author: Nick Virgilio

haiku.text:
all day in grey rain
hollyhocks
follow the sun's
hidden path
haiku.author: Jack Kerouac

haiku.text:
the summer river
even though there is a bridge
I cross by wading
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
a hill of rape flowers
the moon in the east
the sun in the west
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
fallen petals rise
back to the branch I watch
oh butterflies
haiku.author: Arakida Moritake

haiku.text:
now from heart to heart
what remains between us
flowers
haiku.author: Taniguchi Buson

haiku.text:
a world of pain
even when cherry blossoms
have bloomed
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
lighting one candle
from another
spring evening
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
sick on my journey
only my dreams will wander
these desolate moors
haiku.author: Matsuo Basho

haiku.text:
heat haze shimmer
over my railroad rails
far away
haiku.author: Masaoka Shiki

haiku.text:
barn's burnt down
now I can see
the moon
haiku.author: Mizuta Masahide

haiku.text:
full moon
my ramshackle hut
is what it is
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
having slept the camellia
spills yesterday's rain
and falls
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
writing shit about new snow
for the snow flies
it is water
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
to write is human
not to write is also human
rain falls on both
haiku.author: Jack Kerouac

haiku.text:
broken boat
in a sea of moonlight
haiku.author: Jim Harrison

haiku.text:
at the edge
of a great darkness
the firefly
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
the leaping fish
and the face of the pool
that receives it
haiku.author: Dag Hammarskjold

haiku.text:
empty elevator
opens
closes
haiku.author: Jack Hagstrom

haiku.text:
the old calendar
filled with someone else's
important dates
haiku.author: Peggy Lyles

haiku.text:
moving into the sun
the pony takes with him
some old man's shadow
haiku.author: Marlene Mountain

haiku.text: snow in the begging bowl
haiku.author: Taneda Santoka

haiku.text:
spring dusk
clinging to the bell
the bell's echo
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
leaf blowers
have you noticed
nothing has changed
haiku.author: George Swede

haiku.text:
after the quake
the scarecrow
points another way
haiku.author: George Swede

haiku.text:
pausing
halfway up the stair
moonlight
haiku.author: Elizabeth Searle Lamb

haiku.text:
broken kite
flapping from the tree
high above
haiku.author: Peggy Lyles

haiku.text:
spring breeze
the pull of her hand
as we near the toyshop
haiku.author: Peggy Lyles

haiku.text:
warm rain before dawn
water birds crying
in the dark
haiku.author: John Wills

haiku.text:
the first firefly
but he got away
and darkness
haiku.author: Kobayashi Issa

haiku.text:
into a forest
I called
the echo
answered
haiku.author: Taneda Santoka

haiku.text:
just enough of rain
to bring the smell
of silk umbrellas
haiku.author: Yosa Buson

haiku.text:
a whole day alone
except for a fly
in my teacup
haiku.author: Ozaki Hosai

haiku.text:
coughing
even alone
haiku.author: Ozaki Hosai

haiku.text:
nothing to eat
I look at my hands
front and back
haiku.author: Ozaki Hosai

haiku.text:
toward those short days
bending
bending
haiku.author: Taneda Santoka
